body:
### Problem

After nvim upgrade

When i try to :h

Error detected while processing BufReadPost Autocommands for "*":
Error executing lua callback: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30: Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:31: BufReadPost Autocommands for "*"..FileType Autocommands for "*"..
function <SNR>1_LoadFTPlugin[20]..script /usr/share/nvim/runtime/ftplugin/help.lua: Vim(runtime):E5113: Error while calling lua chunk: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/language.lua:98: no
parser for 'vimdoc' language, see :help treesitter-parsers
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'error'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/language.lua:98: in function 'add'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:113: in function 'new'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:64: in function '_create_parser'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:131: in function 'get_parser'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:468: in function 'start'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/ftplugin/help.lua:2: in main chunk
        [C]: in function 'nvim_cmd'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:31: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30>
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_call'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:10>
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_cmd'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:31: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30>
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_call'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:10>
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_call'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:30: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/filetype.lua:10>
        
        No problem on the erlier version
        
        
All upgraded under :Lazy and :Mason

### Steps to reproduce

nvim
:h

### Expected behavior

No error

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3 Compilation: /usr/bin/cc -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16=. -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -O2 -g -Og -g -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -fsigned-char -fstack-protector-strong -fno-common -Wno-unused-result -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=auto -DUNIT_TESTING -DHAVE_UNIBILIUM -D_GNU_SOURCE -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_MAX_START_DEPTH -I/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/usr/include -I/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16/.deps/usr/include -I/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16/build/src/nvim/auto -I/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16/build/include -I/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16/build/cmake.config -I/build/neovim-Iul9eU/neovim-0.10.0~ubuntu1+git202312102103-529498685-c60402a16/src     system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"   fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/share/nvim"

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no nvim 0.9.4 - OK

### Operating system/version

Windows + WSL

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal

### $TERM environment variable

-

### Installation

apt

comment_data.body:
> parser for 'vimdoc' language,

`:checkhealth` should give a hint. Your existing install needs to be cleaned or fixed.

This is a problem with your install. Searching closed  issues.

I tried in on fresh install (~/.local/shared/nvim) folder deleted.
Under :checkhealth I got:

mason.nvim [Languages] ~
- WARNING Go: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: go failed with exit code - and signal -. go is not executable
- WARNING cargo: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: cargo failed with exit code - and signal -. cargo is not executable
- WARNING luarocks: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: luarocks failed with exit code - and signal -. luarocks is not executable
- WARNING Ruby: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: ruby failed with exit code - and signal -. ruby is not executable
- WARNING RubyGem: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: gem failed with exit code - and signal -. gem is not executable
- WARNING javac: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: javac failed with exit code - and signal -. javac is not executable
- WARNING java: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: java failed with exit code - and signal -. java is not executable
- WARNING julia: not available
  - ADVICE:
    - spawn: julia failed with exit code - and signal -. julia is not executable
- OK node: `v20.10.0`
- OK npm: `10.2.3`
- OK PHP: `PHP 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.14 (cli) (built: Aug 18 2023 11:41:11) (NTS)`
- OK Composer: `Composer 2.2.6 2022-02-04 17:00:38`
- OK python: `Python 3.10.12`
- OK pip: `pip 22.0.2 from /usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pip (python 3.10)`
- OK python venv: `Ok`

And

Ruby provider (optional) ~
- WARNING `ruby` and `gem` must be in $PATH.
  - ADVICE:
    - Install Ruby and verify that `ruby` and `gem` commands work.
    
    Perl provider (optional) ~
- WARNING "Neovim::Ext" cpan module is not installed
  - ADVICE:
    - See :help |provider-perl| for more information.
    - You may disable this provider (and warning) by adding `let g:loaded_perl_provider = 0` to your init.vim
    
    
Do I need to install something.
Error detected while processing BufReadPost Autocommands for "":   - still exitst

Under the same config and nvim in version 0.9.4 - everything works - no error

Also, we do not support distro pre-release builds; if you want to test nightly pre-releases, build from source or download the provided appimage. (In this case, the distro build is not installing the -- now mandatory -- treesitter parsers.)

labels.description: issues that are closed as usage questions
labels.name: closed:question

title: Error detected while processing BufReadPost Autocommands for "*":
